intro: Cheiridopsis hilmarii, commonly known as the Hilmarii ice plant, is a small, succulent perennial plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers during the summer months, which attract various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained sandy or rocky soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its compact size and ornamental appeal, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a container plant.
